channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: The planet is getting hotter fast. This is what happens to your body in extreme heat
item.description: Human-caused climate change has already made heat waves around the world more frequent and intense.

item.title: Over 1,000 pilgrims died during this year's Hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia, officials say
item.description: More than 1,000 people died during this year’s Hajj pilgrimage in Saudi Arabia as the faithful faced intense high temperatures at Islamic holy sites in the desert kingdom

item.title: Here's why baby boomers in America are in serious financial trouble — do any of these reasons apply to you?
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: A Massachusetts family's search for justice in 1969 teen murder
item.description: A teen's murder haunts a Massachusetts community — more than 40 years later, would a new witness crack the cold case?

item.title: The Juneteenth flag is full of symbols. Here's what they mean
item.description: Designing the Juneteenth flag was a deliberate process, says creator Ben Haith, who breaks down what each element of the flag represents.

item.title: Helicopters scramble to rescue people in flooded Iowa town
item.description: Drone video showed no streets, just roofs and the tops of trees above water.

item.title: A year ago, her engagement ring vanished at a hospital. She still cherishes the man who gave it to her
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: 6/22: CBS Weekend News
item.description: Punishing heat wave bakes U.S.; Legendary surfing dog helps people overcome challenges by riding waves

item.title: June 18 2024: US heat wave news
item.description: A dangerous heat wave is scorching parts of the Midwest and Northeast. Record-breaking high temperatures are forecast across dozens of cities where cooling centers have been opened to protect the vulnerable.

item.title: At least 11 injured as bus crashes into Seattle building, fire department says
item.description: The Sound Transit bus ran into a building at the intersection of 5th Avenue and Terrace Street in downtown just before 7 p.m., the Seattle Fire Department said.

item.title: It was meant to be a Christian utopia. Now this Nigerian community is helpless against rising seas
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: When Social Security mistakenly overpays benefits, you might get a bill | 60 Minutes
item.description: Each year, about a million people are told they owe the Social Security Administration money because the agency miscalculated their benefits and paid them too much.

item.title: 'I know it happens': Boeing chief admits the company has retaliated against whistleblowers
item.description: The outgoing chief of the embattled airplane maker is testifying in the wake of a whistleblower's allegations of safety issues.

item.title: Philadelphia police officer shot by fleeing suspect is in critical condition
item.description: Officials in Philadelphia say a police officer has been shot in the neck and is in critical condition

item.title: Philippines not in business of instigating wars, says President Marcos
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: Jade Janks and the Secret Photos
item.description: A woman discovers explicit photos of herself on her stepfather’s computer. Soon after, he’s found dead. Jade is a likely suspect, but did she do it? "48 Hours" correspondent Tracy Smith reports.

item.title: June 17, 2024 - Israel-Gaza news
item.description: Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has disbanded the country's war cabinet, an Israeli official says, just over a week after opposition leader Benny Gantz withdrew from the body.

item.title: 2 people were taken to a hospital after lightning struck a tree near a PGA Tour event in Connecticut
item.description: Lightning struck a tree along a golf course hosting the Travelers Championship.

item.title: ‘They saved their whole lives for this’: American woman’s heartbreak as parents die on Hajj
item.description: Read more on this topic here

item.title: The Pact
item.description: A 15-year-old boy goes to a dance and never returns. Teen killers keep a secret for 40 years – until one of them cracks. "48 Hours" correspondent Richard Schlesinger reports.
